trans-unit.source: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.

trans-unit.source: Transcode media files
trans-unit.target: Transcode media files

trans-unit.source: Transcode media files
trans-unit.target: Transcode media files

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**Windows.Media.Transcoding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207105) APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**Windows.Media.Transcoding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207105) APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.

trans-unit.source: *Transcoding* is the conversion of a digital media file, such as a video or audio file, from one format to another.
trans-unit.target: *Transcoding* is the conversion of a digital media file, such as a video or audio file, from one format to another.

trans-unit.source: This is usually done by decoding and then re-encoding the file.
trans-unit.target: This is usually done by decoding and then re-encoding the file.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might convert a Windows Media file to MP4 so that it can be played on a portable device that supports MP4 format.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might convert a Windows Media file to MP4 so that it can be played on a portable device that supports MP4 format.

trans-unit.source: Or, you might convert a high-definition video file to a lower resolution.
trans-unit.target: Or, you might convert a high-definition video file to a lower resolution.

trans-unit.source: In that case, the re-encoded file might use the same codec as the original file, but it would have a different encoding profile.
trans-unit.target: In that case, the re-encoded file might use the same codec as the original file, but it would have a different encoding profile.

trans-unit.source: Set up your project for transcoding
trans-unit.target: Set up your project for transcoding

trans-unit.source: In addition to the namespaces referenced by the default project template, you will need to reference these namespaces in order to transcode media files using the code in this article.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the namespaces referenced by the default project template, you will need to reference these namespaces in order to transcode media files using the code in this article.

trans-unit.source: Using
trans-unit.target: Using

trans-unit.source: Select source and destination files
trans-unit.target: Select source and destination files

trans-unit.source: The way that your app determines the source and destination files for transcoding depends on your implementation.
trans-unit.target: The way that your app determines the source and destination files for transcoding depends on your implementation.

trans-unit.source: This example uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) and a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to allow the user to pick a source and a destination file.
trans-unit.target: This example uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) and a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to allow the user to pick a source and a destination file.

trans-unit.source: TranscodeGetFile
trans-unit.target: TranscodeGetFile

trans-unit.source: Create a media encoding profile
trans-unit.target: Create a media encoding profile

trans-unit.source: The encoding profile contains the settings that determine how the destination file will be encoded.
trans-unit.target: The encoding profile contains the settings that determine how the destination file will be encoded.

trans-unit.source: This is where you have the greatest number of options when you transcode a file.
trans-unit.target: This is where you have the greatest number of options when you transcode a file.

trans-unit.source: The [**MediaEncodingProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701026) class provides static methods for creating predefined encoding profiles:
trans-unit.target: The [**MediaEncodingProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701026) class provides static methods for creating predefined encoding profiles:

trans-unit.source: Wav
trans-unit.target: Wav

trans-unit.source: AAC audio (M4A)
trans-unit.target: AAC audio (M4A)

trans-unit.source: MP3 audio
trans-unit.target: MP3 audio

trans-unit.source: Windows Media Audio (WMA)
trans-unit.target: Windows Media Audio (WMA)

trans-unit.source: Avi
trans-unit.target: Avi

trans-unit.source: MP4 video (H.264 video plus AAC audio)
trans-unit.target: MP4 video (H.264 video plus AAC audio)

trans-unit.source: Windows Media Video (WMV)
trans-unit.target: Windows Media Video (WMV)

trans-unit.source: The first four profiles in this list contain audio only.
trans-unit.target: The first four profiles in this list contain audio only.

trans-unit.source: The other three contain video and audio.
trans-unit.target: The other three contain video and audio.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a profile for MP4 video.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a profile for MP4 video.

trans-unit.source: TranscodeMediaProfile
trans-unit.target: TranscodeMediaProfile

trans-unit.source: The static [**CreateMp4**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701078) method creates an MP4 encoding profile.
trans-unit.target: The static [**CreateMp4**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701078) method creates an MP4 encoding profile.

trans-unit.source: The parameter for this method gives the target resolution for the video.
trans-unit.target: The parameter for this method gives the target resolution for the video.

trans-unit.source: In this case, [**VideoEncodingQuality.hd720p**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701290) means 1280 x 720 pixels at 30 frames per second.
trans-unit.target: In this case, [**VideoEncodingQuality.hd720p**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701290) means 1280 x 720 pixels at 30 frames per second.

trans-unit.source: ("720p" stands for 720 progressive scan lines per frame.) The other methods for creating predefined profiles all follow this pattern.
trans-unit.target: ("720p" stands for 720 progressive scan lines per frame.) The other methods for creating predefined profiles all follow this pattern.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can create a profile that matches an existing media file by using the [**MediaEncodingProfile.CreateFromFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701047) method.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can create a profile that matches an existing media file by using the [**MediaEncodingProfile.CreateFromFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701047) method.

trans-unit.source: Or, if you know the exact encoding settings that you want, you can create a new [**MediaEncodingProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701026) object and fill in the profile details.
trans-unit.target: Or, if you know the exact encoding settings that you want, you can create a new [**MediaEncodingProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701026) object and fill in the profile details.

trans-unit.source: Transcode the file
trans-unit.target: Transcode the file

trans-unit.source: To transcode the file, create a new [**MediaTranscoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207080) object and call the [**MediaTranscoder.PrepareFileTranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700936) method.
trans-unit.target: To transcode the file, create a new [**MediaTranscoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207080) object and call the [**MediaTranscoder.PrepareFileTranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700936) method.

trans-unit.source: Pass in the source file, the destination file, and the encoding profile.
trans-unit.target: Pass in the source file, the destination file, and the encoding profile.

trans-unit.source: Then call the [**TranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700946) method on the [**PrepareTranscodeResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700941) object that was returned from the async transcode operation.
trans-unit.target: Then call the [**TranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700946) method on the [**PrepareTranscodeResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700941) object that was returned from the async transcode operation.

trans-unit.source: TranscodeTranscodeFile
trans-unit.target: TranscodeTranscodeFile

trans-unit.source: Respond to transcoding progress
trans-unit.target: Respond to transcoding progress

trans-unit.source: You can register events to respond when the progress of the asynchronous [**TranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700946) changes.
trans-unit.target: You can register events to respond when the progress of the asynchronous [**TranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700946) changes.

trans-unit.source: These events are part of the async programming framework for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and are not specific to the transcoding API.
trans-unit.target: These events are part of the async programming framework for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and are not specific to the transcoding API.

trans-unit.source: TranscodeCallbacks
trans-unit.target: TranscodeCallbacks
